channel.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
channel.description: Is it possible to make this happen if so how would i go about doing it

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

no it’s because the carpet is moving faster than run speed

Read full topic

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Death Style:

i’m like 99% sure if i were to follow someone on a carpet they’d outrun me

Perhaps its because the carpet moves in a different way. Your player is very flexible, but the carpet cannot go diagonally. I wonder why…

Read full topic

When travelling in this mode, the carpet carrying the player moves towards the destination in running speed.
[/quote]

Source(s):
http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Magic_carpet[/quote]Ill have to try it on 07 again, but at least it seems like you’re moving faster than running… maybe its an illusion?

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

had a look and the magic carpet doesn’t seem to be jumping based on the minimap

not sure what’s going on then. maybe the server is sending that player’s update packet 2x faster than everyone else?

doesn’t really explain why it moves faster, not sure if that isn’t just the client trying to “correct” the position by speeding up the player, like when you lag and people who were walking begin running

Read full topic

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“cedia, post:21, topic:545769”][quote author=Death Style link=topic=664653.msg4443225#msg4443225 date=1407610050]
npcs never ran until that forgiveness of a chaos dwarf quest came out or something
[/quote]

NPCs always had the ability to run but they weren’t really used ingame until they made familiars run. This was tested at revision 550 where the dwarf quest wasn’t released but its still possible to make NPCs run via NPC updating.[/quote]
Agreed entirely. Its actually more noticeable now. In RS3 (basically anything 562 too), when its loading the screen, you can see the men and women running (with the run animation).

Read full topic

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Death Style, post:13, topic:545769”]you can actually move the coords of a player without breaking an animation but most sources probably don’t support that.

if you ride a magic carpet you never seem to move diagonally so I think there’s some animation where the player moves quickly over three or more tiles and they’re just jumping the player’s coords[/quote]

If this is the case you should look at the minimap and see if your white dot is jumping around instead of moving gradually

unless the minimap is disabled…

Read full topic

npcs never ran until that forgiveness of a chaos dwarf quest came out or something

NPCs always had the ability to run but they weren’t really used ingame until they made familiars run. This was tested at revision 550 where the dwarf quest wasn’t released but its still possible to make NPCs run via NPC updating.

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

you can actually move the coords of a player without breaking an animation but most sources probably don’t support that.

if you ride a magic carpet you never seem to move diagonally so I think there’s some animation where the player moves quickly over three or more tiles and they’re just jumping the player’s coords

Read full topic

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:11, topic:545769”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=664653.msg4443140#msg4443140 date=1407546462]

The reason its like this is because of how the map works. The player is ALWAYS on a tile, never in between. When it looks like you are walking, your position in the client is actually on the next tile, its just there’s a flag that says ‘ok we are walking we should draw the player between the tiles not the tile they are actually on’. So your speed is indicated in ‘tiles per tick’ with walking be 1 and running being 2. You can’t move half a tile, or any other fraction, so you cannot increase the speed unless you want walking to be 2 and running to be 3. 3 might be the speed of carpets, I’d have to take a look at the player updating client-sided again to see if it is that simple or if its handled different like Death Style said.

alright so if it works with the example you said tiles per tick would this be a server sided thing for me to change or on the client sided, and if so would it be as simple as just changing a 1 to a 3 or would it be more difficult than that
[/quote]That is a crazy speed, and no it wouldn’t be that simple. You would have to change your player updating, and possibly the client sided player updating depending on whether or not it supports the 3 tiles per tick speed (based on what Death Style is saying it may not)[/quote]

so what hes saying is it would move from x=1000 to x=1003 then x=1006 and so on and have an animation that makes it seem as if the player is really moving that fast? because if so how would that work because wouldnt the animation restart once the player is moved

Read full topic

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“hadlich4, post:10, topic:545769”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=664653.msg4443137#msg4443137 date=1407545955]
The reason its like this is because of how the map works. The player is ALWAYS on a tile, never in between. When it looks like you are walking, your position in the client is actually on the next tile, its just there’s a flag that says ‘ok we are walking we should draw the player between the tiles not the tile they are actually on’. So your speed is indicated in ‘tiles per tick’ with walking be 1 and running being 2. You can’t move half a tile, or any other fraction, so you cannot increase the speed unless you want walking to be 2 and running to be 3. 3 might be the speed of carpets, I’d have to take a look at the player updating client-sided again to see if it is that simple or if its handled different like Death Style said.
[/quote]

alright so if it works with the example you said tiles per tick would this be a server sided thing for me to change or on the client sided, and if so would it be as simple as just changing a 1 to a 3 or would it be more difficult than that[/quote]That is a crazy speed, and no it wouldn’t be that simple. You would have to change your player updating, and possibly the client sided player updating depending on whether or not it supports the 3 tiles per tick speed (based on what Death Style is saying it may not)

Read full topic

The reason its like this is because of how the map works. The player is ALWAYS on a tile, never in between. When it looks like you are walking, your position in the client is actually on the next tile, its just there’s a flag that says ‘ok we are walking we should draw the player between the tiles not the tile they are actually on’. So your speed is indicated in ‘tiles per tick’ with walking be 1 and running being 2. You can’t move half a tile, or any other fraction, so you cannot increase the speed unless you want walking to be 2 and running to be 3. 3 might be the speed of carpets, I’d have to take a look at the player updating client-sided again to see if it is that simple or if its handled different like Death Style said.

alright so if it works with the example you said tiles per tick would this be a server sided thing for me to change or on the client sided, and if so would it be as simple as just changing a 1 to a 3 or would it be more difficult than that

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?

item.description:

I’m pretty sure they do that with npcs too because if you go to the varrock museum and try to right click the digsite worker who brings a wheelbarrow back and forth the right click menu always disappears, and that only happens when an npc teleports/no longer exists/out of view

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

The reason its like this is because of how the map works. The player is ALWAYS on a tile, never in between. When it looks like you are walking, your position in the client is actually on the next tile, its just there’s a flag that says ‘ok we are walking we should draw the player between the tiles not the tile they are actually on’. So your speed is indicated in ‘tiles per tick’ with walking be 1 and running being 2. You can’t move half a tile, or any other fraction, so you cannot increase the speed unless you want walking to be 2 and running to be 3. 3 might be the speed of carpets, I’d have to take a look at the player updating client-sided again to see if it is that simple or if its handled different like Death Style said.

Read full topic

item.title: Making player/npc run/walk faster?
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

like magic carpets?

I think the server just edits the player’s coordinates while using an animation that looks like the player is actually moving to the spot
